reporting_cycle: The Secretary-General to keep the Security Council regularly informed
summary:
5. Urges Gulf of Guinea states to develop and implement national maritime security strategies, including a legal framework for preventing and repressing piracy, and prosecution and punishment of those convicted.

6. Encourages Benin and Nigeria to extend joint patrols and international partners to provide support.

7. Encourages Gulf of Guinea states, ECOWAS, ECCAS, and GGC to develop transnational and transregional maritime security coordination centres.

8. Encourages international partners to provide support to enhance regional capabilities to counter piracy.

9. Requests the Secretary-General to support mobilizing resources for building national and regional capacities.

10. Requests the Secretary-General to keep the Security Council informed on piracy in the Gulf of Guinea.

11. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
